passage_text: Go to the Line C1 of RENFE running which runs from Terminal 4 Madrid-Barajas airport to the city centre. The train stops at Chamartin, Nuevos Ministerios, Atocha, Mendez Avaro, and Principe Pio.

Madrid-Barajas Airport (code IATA: MAD, code OACI: LEMD) is located on the northeast of Madrid, Barajas district, only 12 kilometers from Madrid city centre. The airport changed its name from Madrid-Barajas to Adolfo Suarez Suárez-Madrid barajas in. 2014
The visitor to Madrid has several options to get from Barajas Airport to the city centre. These are: Aerocity, AresMobile, Bus (Airport Express) , Car Rental, Metro, and Taxi. Aerocity.

Luggage storage is available at Terminals 1, 2 and 4. Getting from the airport to Madrid’s city centre is made simple by how well-connected it is. You can grab the metro, the bus, the train or a taxi. Hop on metro line 8 from Madrid-Barajas (in any terminal) to Nuevos Ministerios in Madrid's city centre. The trip takes around 15 minutes. From there you can transfer to metro lines 6 and 10.
Granada City Center is 20 km from the Granada Airport. Granada  Airport mainly handles flights to Madrid and Barcelona. The Granada  Airport was opened in 1972.

Major airports near Madrid, Spain: The nearest major airport is Madrid-Cuatro Vientos Airport (MCV / LECU). This airport has international flights and is 18 km from the center of Madrid, Spain.
